Detailed Description

Select the next microcode word to execute.

The microcode_branch module is responsible for selecting the next microcode word to execute. This decision is based on the value of the current microcode word, the value of the interrupt privilege level, the state of the current bus cycle and other internal signals.

The microcode_branch module implements a simple stack for the microcode addresses. This makes it possible to call subroutines inside the microcode.

Definition at line 3435 of file ao68000.v.

 
03435 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
03436     if(reset_n == 1'b0) micro_pc_0 <= 9'd0;
03437     else                micro_pc_0 <= micro_pc;
03438 end
[Always Construct]
ALWAYS_33 ( clock ,
reset_n )

Definition at line 3440 of file ao68000.v.

 
03440 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
03441     if(reset_n == 1'b0) begin
03442         micro_pc_1 <= 9'd0;
03443         micro_pc_2 <= 9'd0;
03444         micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03445     end
03446     else if(branch_control == `BRANCH_stop_flag_wait_ir_decode && prefetch_ir_valid == 1'b1 && decoder_trap == 8'd0)
03447     begin
03448         micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + { 5'd0, branch_offset };
03449         micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03450         micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03451     end
03452     else if(branch_control == `BRANCH_procedure) begin
03453         if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_read && load_ea != 9'd0) begin
03454             micro_pc_1 <= perform_ea_read;
03455             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03456             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_1;
03457         end
03458         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_read && load_ea == 9'd0) begin
03459             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03460             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03461             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03462         end
03463         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_write && save_ea != 9'd0) begin
03464             micro_pc_1 <= save_ea;
03465             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03466             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03467         end
03468         else if((branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_load_ea && load_ea != 9'd0) ||
03469                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_perform_ea_read) ||
03470                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_perform_ea_write) ||
03471                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_save_ea && save_ea != 9'd0) ||
03472                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_trap) )
03473         begin
03474             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03475             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03476             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03477         end
03478         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_return) begin
03479             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_2;
03480             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_3;
03481             micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03482         end
03483         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_push_micropc) begin
03484             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0;
03485             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03486             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03487         end
03488         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_pop_micropc) begin
03489             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_2;
03490             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_3;
03491             micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03492         end
03493     end
03494 end
